DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reporting periods for which the STMF is being completed.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Timepoint Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The period prior to enrollment.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Timepoint Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Name
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Clearly characterized or delimited.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
